availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Ohio
Hamilton County
and City of Cincinnait ss

I, John G. Douglass a Commissioner appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky in the state of Ohio do make solemn oath that I will well and truly execute and perform all the duties of said office according to the best of my ability
Signed in my presence & sworn to by John G. Douglass before me this 30th, day of October 1861 -- as witness my hand & official seal at Cincinnati

John W. Applegate,
Commissioner of Kentucky,
in the State of Ohio,

figure.ab:
JOHN W. APPLEGATE
COMMISSIONER
FOR
KENTUCKY
CINCINNATI OHIO

body.p:
Ohio
Oath of
Jno. G. Douglass
Comr of Deeds
